availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, confectioner. Virginia native. Married Susan P. Gray. Father of Thresly B. Gray, William K. Gray, Alice Gray, Franklin Gray, Preston Gray, and Anna T. Gray. Confectioner in Frankfort in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 80. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 19. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 13. Find A Grave, "W H Gray (1815-1885)," Memorial #59867956, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=59867956&ref=acom (accessed May 24, 2017).
